intro: Kohleria eriantha, commonly known as the silver leaf kohleria, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its striking, velvety leaves that often have a silvery or white appearance. The plant produces clusters of small, tubular flowers in shades of red, orange, or yellow, which bloom during the warmer months. Kohleria eriantha thrives in bright, indirect light and requires consistent moisture and well-draining soil. It is often cultivated as a decorative plant due to its unique foliage and ornamental flowers.
